topics.body: Should I watch the Big Lebowski drunk, high, both or sobber to get a better experience?
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5351234a6368726a98970000#post_5351234a6368726a98970000
Watch anything drunk is not usually fun, except that you sometimes aren't even watching/
Watch anything high is sometimes fun, mostly not.
Both is just trying to commit suicide.
Sober is fun if you 'get' the story.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53512519636872279a300000#post_53512519636872279a300000

That's the point, there's not really a story, it's all about the conversations and those lead to a dead end most of the time. I'm not saying they're not good, on the contrary, they're what makes the movie. But I was asking if the experience can be affected by other factors and give you a different point of view like when watching Yellow Submarine

topics.body:
I'm starting to think I have some kind of social anxiety disorder.
When I was younger, I was somewhat outgoing with classmates. However I got bullied every now and again and would sometimes say things that are idiotic (I have a HORRIBLE habit of speaking first, then thinking). Over time I've decided that the best thing for me to do is remain completely quiet with strangers and try not be noticeable.
I'm going out of it now but looking back, it seems obvious.
topics.author: 515ddf93a4c72d8a1f000d57
